Well, let's analyze the subject a second, cliques---A small exclusive group of friends or associates...they are your crew, crowd, your family away from your family, and the term i've grown up with---BARKADA--the people you hang out with.

so what brings me to this discussion of cliques is that lately, wherever i go, most notably at school...my peers tend to form these factions...maybe it's always been this way, and i just never noticed it, but it's there, and it has been set before my attention..Don't get me wrong, i HAVE friends, all kinds of friends, but it has occurred to me recently that I lack the core group that many of my friends have....how?...well the answer is simple, i've never had one...ever...it never occurred to me that i needed a "group" to call my own....ever since i was little i was content in being friends with everyone--some deeper than others, but friendships nonetheless....all i needed was my best friend to have a sense of solidity in my life....

these thoughts surfaced during my disneyland trip...last year, it was easy to see who would be in my ride group...but this year it was much more difficult...the groups this year were all uneven....and following a number of incidents on the trip, i found myself walking on mainstreet alone...sad to be in the happiest place on earth all by yourself...

these cliques hang out not only at school, but OUTSIDE of school, they go to the movies, shopping, theme park trips, etc....they know each other beyond school...and that is how they're able to build deeper friendships in high school....i got a taste of this when i was invited to a movie nite with one of these famous cliques....the catch?...i had to drive....yes, i was the chaffeur for the night..picking people up, driving them home, and for what???....so i could gain some points with this barkada? that's not me at all...what's going on with me?

I guess it comes down to this....even with 1200 students, high school can be a lonely place...the weekends can be a lot lonlier

Let's see....2004 was to say the least, a pretty tough year....So, I am happy to say that I'm glad it's over. It brought so much pain and drama, I really wasn't equipped to deal with it all. Some friendships i thought were  solid, diminished. I'm really not quite sure if they were genuine in the first place. Too many funerals this year too. I can't or won't forget the people i lost this past year. Still pains me every night. I cry thinking about those who i am close to losing; who slip through the cracks; who, become erased.  

So in 2005, I'm ready for a fresh start. No more drama pleeeze. Incredibly tired of it. All I want to do is be well---me. I want to be the me I was at my highest point in life. When I was always surrounded by people I loved and who loved me in return everyday. Not just fucked up posers who say they love you or they'll be there for you and aren't when life gets fucked up. No, no those people need not be in my life any longer. 

Good Luck in 2005 everyone....i know i'll need it

This had to be one of the hardest days i've had in a long time...it's sad, i finally had to say goodbye.....i don't really know if i have come to terms with joyce's death....she was one a the few constant things in my life, and now that she's gone, what am i going to do???...

I showed up at the church for the funeral service, i greeted sara, joyce's long time partner, and basically my other voice teacher....we held each other....for a very long time...it seemed like if we let go:
JOYCE WOULD REALLY BE GONE....and it was almost like we both couldn't even bear that thought

Unlike most people...i was accompanied by a few friends, among them being eileen, tatiana, omar, and t
i had a lump in my throat the whole time....omar held back his tears too...but t just couldn't help it...she let it go
i didnt cry....until sara spoke....hit home real bad....
"she's given each of you a gift, and only you know what she's given you"

how can i keep from singing?????
i find myself absentmindedly singing songs she taught me, everything from disney tunes to maxwell house commercial songs...it's crazy

i'll never keep from singing...especially for joyce

i dont know wen it gets easier...one day at a time i guess
http://mahalkitafolife.livejournal.com/20403.html

so today i went to Joyce's wake which is basically the viewing of her body with a little prayer service and people get the chance to speak about her...i am pretty cried out...so i decided that i'd go up...and when i got up there, of course i was ready to cry again...so i talked real fast so i wouldn't break down in front of people...this is what i said:

joyce was one of the most beautiful people i've ever met and probably will ever know...i probably wasn't one of her better students vocally but she made me feel like i was...she always made sure i was in a dress and was made up for every concert, recital, or performance....before i met her i was strictly hip hop, r&b, and pop...she showed me the beauty in classical, musicals, showtunes...and all different kinds of genres...she loved me unconditionally............joyce, i will miss you...and i love you from the bottom of my heart...

so tomorrow's the funeral...christine, omar, and many other choir friends will be there....we'll get thru it together...peace out
http://mahalkitafolife.livejournal.com/20180.html

my voice teacher died today

her name was JOYCE FIZZOLIO

she was one of the most beautiful people I ever met...I studied under her for 4 years...she introduced me to a whole new world of music...taught me how to sing in italian, french, and latin...helped me discover genres of music like classical, show tunes, jazz, musicals, operas, operettas, pop, blues, everything..........she showed me that there is beauty in every piece of music...you just need to find it....

i can't even begin to explain how much i'm going to miss her...i loved her so much....i have no clue what i am gonna do now that she's gone

I know God will take care of her in Heaven.......
